intro: Hartogia cephalotes, commonly known as the Cape Town daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hartogia cephalotes is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
